p.b: A workset is a refset “frozen” in a point of time and associated to a project

ul.li: Open the workset tab on the right panel and click “Create new workset”. A new window is displayed in order to enter a new workset name.
A message is displayed upon clicking OK:
You will not be able to create two worksets with the same name. The following message will appear when trying to do so:

Once you have entered a new workset name you should define the refset from which you will obtain the concepts to be translated. Once again, the source refset and any additional features may be displayed by clicking the respective tabs on the right panel:

Define your source refset: Open the taxonomy tab on the left pane and select the refset containing the concepts to the translated. Drag and drop it into the Source Refset field in the right panel. Then click “save”.
Save your specifications. If you have forgotten to save your source refset and try to synchronize without saving, an error message will de shown:
Upon saving the source refset, the list and the number of refset members is displayed. However, if you open the Workset members tab, you will see that it is still empty:
As the screen helps shows, the list of workset members will only be shown after synchronizing the workset with the source refset.

Define your exclusion refsets (if any): Whenever you have a refset of concepts that will not be translated, you should specify them as an exclusion refset before synchronizing your refset. Any exclusion refset must be defined in the project. Otherwise, the refset will not be excluded.

Save your specifications.
A message appears when the specifications have been saved. However, you must synchronize your workset with the source refset in order to ensure they are identical.
A refset is mutable and does not belong to the Translation Process, but a Workset does. Therefore there is a need to keep one or more copies of a set of data consistent with the refset created for the translation process.
Example: The refset manager created a refset for translation of body structures and submitted them to the Project Manager on May 1st, 2010 at 9:00 a.m. Since then, the Body structure hierarchy has been changed and about 100 concepts had been added in July 31st release. The project manager created worksets for translation and when he synchronized them the Source refset used was the one submitted on May 1st, which is different to the SNOMED edition released on July 31st. Therefore, the workset that is already in the transaltion workflow does not include the 100 new concepts, this separation from the new version of the refset allows the monitoring of the progress to the completion of the workset tasks not to be affected by the recent changes. This is why the definition of worksets states that they are refsets frozen in a point of time and associated to a project. According to this , synchronization is the “freezing” action: your workset will be an exact copy of the refset created on May 1st.
Click “Sync” button to synchronize your refset. A confirmation message is displayed:
Another message is displayed when synchronization has been completed:
If you open the Members tab now, you will see that the Workset member list is exactly the same as the source refset:
The source refset members are displayed in alphabetical order, and the workset members will be shown in the members tab.
